page.title: 07LEISURE IN PURSTON JAGLIN
page.content: Purston is extremely fortunate in having a variety of man made and natural leisure facilities. A council owned sports centre was recently built next to the local high school. The people who most commonly visit the centre are predominantly aged between eighteen and thirty. The activities available range from paraplegic basketball and keep fit to martial arts. Purston also has a large park which offers a variety of activities ranging from walking the dog, or playing football, to bowls. Purston also has a number of betting shops and public houses. One of the most popular hobbies amongst older people, however, is gardening and the town has number of allotments catering for this interest.
